```{python}
#| label: disease-war-curing-costs-column-chart
#| fig-cap: "Cost of Disease vs War Costs vs Curing Diseases"

import sys
import os
from pathlib import Path

# Add project root to path (find it relative to current working directory)
project_root = Path.cwd()
if project_root.name != 'decentralized-institutes-of-health':
    while project_root.name != 'decentralized-institutes-of-health' and project_root.parent != project_root:
        project_root = project_root.parent
sys.path.insert(0, str(project_root))

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from brain.charts._chart_style import (
    setup_chart_style, add_watermark, clean_spines,
    COLOR_BLACK, COLOR_RED, COLOR_BLUE, COLOR_WHITE
)

# Setup styling
setup_chart_style(style='light', dpi=150)

# Disease burden (from cost-of-disease.qmd)
disease_medical = 9900  # Direct medical costs
disease_productivity = 5000  # Lost productivity
disease_lives = 94200  # Lost human life (DALYs)
disease_total = disease_medical + disease_productivity + disease_lives  # $109.1T

# War costs breakdown
war_direct = 2720  # Direct military spending
war_infrastructure = 1875  # Infrastructure destruction
war_lives_trade = 1616  # Human life losses + trade disruption
war_longterm = 3538  # Lost growth, veterans, refugees, environment
war_indirect_total = war_infrastructure + war_lives_trade + war_longterm

# Cure research spending
cure_total = 68  # Global government medical research spending

categories = [
    'Cost of\nDisease',
    'War\'s Hidden\nCosts',
    'War Direct\nSpending',
    'Curing\nDiseases'
]

# Create figure
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(28, 12))

# Column 1: Total Disease Burden (RED - problem)
ax.bar(0, disease_total, color=COLOR_RED, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=3, width=0.8)
disease_breakdown_text = (
    f'${disease_total/1000:.0f}T\nTotal\n\n'
    f'Medical\nCosts:\n${disease_medical/1000:.0f}T\n'
    f'Lost\nProductivity:\n${disease_productivity/1000:.0f}T\n'
    f'Lost Lives\n(DALYs):\n${disease_lives/1000:.0f}T'
)
ax.text(0, disease_total * 0.5, disease_breakdown_text, ha='center', va='center',
        fontsize=28, weight='bold', color=COLOR_WHITE, linespacing=1.5)

# Column 2: War Indirect Costs (RED - problem)
ax.bar(1, war_indirect_total, color=COLOR_RED, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=3, width=0.8)
war_indirect_text = (
    f'${war_indirect_total/1000:.0f}T\nTotal\n\n'
    f'Infrastructure:\n${war_infrastructure/1000:.0f}T\n'
    f'Lives + Trade:\n${war_lives_trade/1000:.0f}T\n'
    f'Lost Growth:\n${war_longterm/1000:.0f}T'
)
ax.text(1, war_indirect_total * 0.5, war_indirect_text, ha='center', va='center',
        fontsize=28, weight='bold', color=COLOR_WHITE, linespacing=1.5)

# Column 3: War Direct Spending (RED - problem)
ax.bar(2, war_direct, color=COLOR_RED, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=3, width=0.8)
ax.text(2, war_direct * 0.5, f'${war_direct/1000:.1f}T\n\nDirect\nMilitary',
        ha='center', va='center', fontsize=44, weight='bold', color=COLOR_WHITE)

# Column 4: Cure Research Spending (BLUE - solution)
ax.bar(3, cure_total, color=COLOR_BLUE, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=3, width=0.8)
ax.text(3, cure_total + (disease_total * 0.005), f'${cure_total:.0f}B',
        ha='center', va='bottom', fontsize=44, weight='bold', color=COLOR_BLACK)

# Styling - remove decimals, use black for text
ax.set_xticks([0, 1, 2, 3])
ax.set_xticklabels(categories)
ax.set_ylabel('Annual Cost (Billions)', fontsize=36, weight='bold', color=COLOR_BLACK)
ax.tick_params(axis='x', labelsize=32, colors=COLOR_BLACK)
ax.tick_params(axis='y', labelsize=28, colors=COLOR_BLACK)
ax.yaxis.set_major_formatter(plt.FuncFormatter(lambda x, p: f'{x/1000:.0f}T' if x >= 1000 else f'{x:.0f}B'))
clean_spines(ax, ['top', 'right'])
# Remove gridlines for cleaner look
# ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3, color=COLOR_BLACK, axis='y')

# Add branding
add_watermark(fig)

# Save in brain/charts directory
import os
output_dir = project_root / 'brain' / 'charts'
output_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
plt.savefig(output_dir / 'disease-war-curing-costs-column-chart.png', dpi=150, bbox_inches='tight', facecolor=COLOR_WHITE)
plt.show()
```
